[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@genesislcap/foundation-events](./foundation-events.md) &gt; [EventEmitterDI](./foundation-events.eventemitterdi.md)

## EventEmitterDI interface

EventEmitterDI interface.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface EventEmitterDI<TEventDetailMap extends EventDetailMap> 
```

## Remarks

A strongly typed event emitter with events typed to [EventDetailMap](./foundation-events.eventdetailmap.md) pairings. This is closely related to the [EventEmitter](./foundation-events.eventemitter.md) mixin in terms of functionality, however its purpose is different. This allows you to create pre-configured EventEmitters that can be injected anywhere. These can emit typed events from an origin html element, without that element needing to be an actual . If you are starting out, we recommend using the [EventEmitter](./foundation-events.eventemitter.md) mixin where possible.

## Example 1

Create an emitter within the DI.

```ts
import {registerEmitter} from '@genesislcap/foundation-events';
...
export const MyEventEmitter = registerEmitter<MyEventDetailMap>();
```

## Example 2

Use that emitter.

```ts
export class MyComponent extends FASTElement {
  @observable someElement!: HTMLElement;
  @MyEventEmitter emitter: MyEventEmitter;
  connectedCallback() {
    this.emitter.emit(this.someElement, 'some-event', {foo: 'bar'});
  }
}
```

|  --- | --- |
